summary: Barbara J. Robinson was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from November 1977 to January 1979. Payroll and certification reports document her position, salary, and employment dates within the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. These records indicate her sustained employment as a staff member throughout various accounting periods.
significance: Medium. Barbara J. Robinson's significance lies in her documented employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the JFK assassination investigation. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed, her presence on multiple payroll and certification reports suggests a consistent and potentially important contribution to the committee's work.
